# blank5 {.unlisted .unnumbered}

Partial Fractions

Provided that the numerator $f(x)$ is of lower degree than the relevant denominator, the following are typical examples of the form of partial fraction used.
\begin{align*}
\frac{f(x)}{(x+a)(x+b)(x+c)}\\
=\frac{A}{x+a}+\frac{B}{x+b}+\frac{C}{x+c}\\
\frac{f(x)}{(x-a)^3(x+b)}\\
=\frac{A}{x-a}+\frac{B}{(x-a)^2}+\frac{C}{(x-a)^3}+\frac{D}{x+b}\\
\frac{f(x)}{(ax^2+bx+c)(x-d)}\\
=\frac{Ax+B}{ax^2+bx+c}+\frac{C}{x-d}.
\end{align*}
